column4: Hi guys, I am trying to compile PHP on 10.11 and it can not find apxs - I have done some extensive searching and can not find a hint as to where the location of it may be.
there is no such thing as 10.11
do you mean 11.10?
Sorry yes 11.10...
which PHP are you compiling?  you should be able to use what's already in the repos
php5 exists in the repos
ah... yeah you might run into issues compiling the newer versions of PHP for 10.10
well do you absolutely need 5.3.8?
i assume upgrading to natty or oneiric is out of the question?
do you absolutely need ***CUTTING EDGE*** PHP
then you're kind of SOL
the file you need to build php doesnt exist on maverick (10.10)
"s*** out of luck"
in a few months maverick is going to be out of date...
at which point you'll kinda need to upgrade
you could upgrade to 11.04 (which is stable)
there's many windows managers and what not
if yo udont want to switch to other environments, i'd install gnome-shell and then use that rather than unity
Yea I know about all of those. XFCE and LXDE are ok but I dont think they live up to how I would use them. I dont really like KDE - GNOME has a feel about it I just prefer if you get what I mean :)
i uninstalled unity while using unity
It might have something to do with the illuminati??? :D
